title: Best Stocks To Buy And Watch Now: 5 Top Stocks For June
summary:
Best Stocks To Buy: The Crucial IngredientsRemember, there are thousands of stocks trading on the NYSE and Nasdaq.
Invest when the stock market is in a confirmed uptrend and move to cash when the stock market goes into a correction.
Best Stocks To Buy Or WatchNow let's look at Microsoft stock, Apple stock, PayPal stock, ASML stock and UnitedHealth stock in more detail.
Check out IBD Stock Lists and other IBD content to find dozens more of the best stocks to buy or watch.
ASML stock fell 40% in the coronavirus stock market crash from late February to late March before starting its recovery.
text:
Buying a stock is easy, but buying the right stock without a time-tested strategy is incredibly hard. So what are the best stocks to buy now or put on a watchlist? Microsoft (MSFT), Apple (AAPL), PayPal (PYPL), ASML (ASML) and UnitedHealth (UNH) are looking stronger as the stock market continues to bounce back from the severe coronavirus correction.

X

While the long bull market was finally vanquished by the coronavirus crisis, things are looking positive again. The stock market is in a confirmed uptrend, and has recouped much of its loss. The rally has been strengthening, with the tech-heavy Nasdaq clearing key resistance levels and more top stocks breaking out. The uptrend also recently overcame an important test by rebounding from a sharp sell-off.

A key to the rosier picture is the improving news on Covid-19, both in the U.S. and around the world. Many states are now preparing to come out of lockdown and get their economies firing again. However, stress in the oil markets has added to uncertainty.

Join IBD experts as they analyze winning stocks on IBD Live every morning. Take a free trial!

So why are these five names above the rest to buy or watch? Before turning to that question it is important to consider how one goes about choosing a stock in the first place. Superior fundamentals and technical action, and buying at the right time, are all part of a shrewd investing formula.

Several of the stocks named are featured on IBD's prestigious Leaderboard list of top stocks.

Best Stocks To Buy: The Crucial Ingredients

Remember, there are thousands of stocks trading on the NYSE and Nasdaq. But you want to find the very best stocks right now to generate massive gains.

The CAN SLIM system offers clear guidelines on what you should be looking for. Invest in stocks with recent quarterly and annual earnings growth of at least 25%. Look for companies that have new, game-changing products and services. Also consider not-yet-profitable companies, often recent IPOs, that are generating tremendous revenue growth.

IBD's CAN SLIM Investing System has a proven track record of significantly outperforming the S&P 500. Outdoing this industry benchmark is key to generating exceptional returns over the long term.

In addition, keep an eye on supply and demand for the stock itself, focus on leading stocks in top industry groups and aim for stocks with strong institutional support.

Once you have found a stock that fits the criteria, it is then time to turn to stock charts to plot a good entry point. You should wait for a stock to form a base, and then buy once it reaches a buy point, ideally in heavy volume. In many cases, a stock reaches a proper buy point when it breaks above the original high on the left side of the base. More information on what a base is, and how charts can be used to win big on the stock market, can be found here.

Don't Forget The M When Buying Stocks

Never forget that the M in CAN SLIM stands for market. Most stocks, even the very best, will tend to follow the market direction. Invest when the stock market is in a confirmed uptrend and move to cash when the stock market goes into a correction.

The current stock market rally became a confirmed uptrend after the S&P 500 staged a somewhat lackluster follow-through day on April 2. The Nasdaq's April 6 follow-through day was more convincing, and breakouts have been flourishing. The rally also managed to rebound on May 14 from a sharp sell-off, further bolstering its case.

The best market gains often come in the first several weeks after a correction or bear market ends, so investors should be looking for stocks with good fundamental and technical performance, ones capable of staging successful breakouts. More quality stocks are also breaking out now. On a technical basis, look for stocks with rising relative strength lines.

Nevertheless, things can quickly change, so investors should keep a close eye on the market trend page here.

Best Stocks To Buy Or Watch

Now let's look at Microsoft stock, Apple stock, PayPal stock, ASML stock and UnitedHealth stock in more detail. An important consideration is that these stocks all boast impressive relative strength. All of these stocks except ASML are on IBD Leaderboard.

Check out IBD Stock Lists and other IBD content to find dozens more of the best stocks to buy or watch.

Microsoft Stock

Microsoft stock is currently in range from a 180.10 handle in what's either a cup-with-handle or double-bottom base. MSFT stock, which has found support at the 21-day line a few times in recent weeks, has an alternate entry of 187.61. The entry is a four weeks tight, a variant on the three-weeks-tight pattern. Typically, tight patterns are places for existing holders to add a few more shares. But in this case, the four-weeks-tight is essentially another handle within the base.

The relative strength line has pulled back in the past few weeks as Microsoft stock moved sideways while the broader market spiked. But MSFT stock outperformed through the market crash and in the current stock market rally. The RS line, the blue line in the charts below, tracks a stock's performance vs. the S&P 500.

Microsoft stock has been outperforming the S&P 500 index for years. So it's no surprise that MSFT stock is a member of the prestigious IBD Long-Term Leaders list. Stocks on this list stabilize your portfolio but quietly deliver stellar long-term gains. To qualify as a Long-Term Leader, a stock has to have stable earnings, stable price outperformance and high-quality institutional sponsorship. These stocks can be bought on pullbacks or on breakouts.

Microsoft earnings growth has been strong, fueled by cloud-computing services that are in high demand during work-at-home coronavirus shutdowns. On April 29, the Microsoft earnings report for fiscal Q3 showed a 23% EPS gain while revenue rose 15%, the best top-line growth in six quarters.

Microsoft's Commercial Cloud business saw revenue jump 30% year over year to $13.3 billion in its fiscal third quarter. Its Azure cloud-computing services surged 62%. The Microsoft Teams video calling, chat and collaboration suite keeps workers connected.

Analysts see Microsoft earnings rising 20% in fiscal 2020 and 9% in 2021.

Microsoft stock is one of only a handful of U.S.-listed companies with trillion-dollar market caps. Indeed, Microsoft stock is once again worth more than Apple, for now. In this case big is beautiful as Microsoft stock has a perfect IBD Composite Rating of 99.

For a deeper look at Microsoft, check out this recent New America profile.

Apple Stock

On a daily chart, Apple stock is extended from a 228.35 cup-with-handle buy point and is now just below an alternate handle entry of 319.79. On a weekly chart, the 319.79 entry is the conventional buy point. AAPL stock cleared 319.79 three times in the last week, including Friday, but has yet to close above that level.

The relative strength line for Apple stock is around record highs. Apple stock has a strong Composite Rating of 92 out of a best-possible 99, but the IBD Stock Checkup tool shows earnings growth has been disappointing of late. It has averaged 5% growth over the past three quarters, though earnings growth is accelerating.

The firm managed to beat Wall Street's targets for its coronavirus-impacted March quarter. The Cupertino, Calif.-based company earned $2.55 a share on sales of $58.31 billion in its fiscal second quarter ended March 28. Analysts were looking for Apple earnings of $2.26 a share on sales of $54.54 billion.

Apple is also weighing whether to delay the launch of its first 5G smartphones by months, possibly into 2021. The coronavirus pandemic has threatened Apple's production schedule as well as global demand.

PayPal Stock

The Leaderboard stock is just out of buy range from a short-stroke follow-on entry point of 147.30. It comes after a breakaway gap created an alternate entry of 143.33, from which PayPal stock is now extended. PayPal stock has been rallying strongly since hitting a low of 82.07 on March 3.

PYPL stock is leading the rebound in payment stocks. Mastercard (MA) gave investors interested in the space reasons for optimism, as it has said it is seeing a slight rebound in credit card use amid a relaxation in social distancing rules and fiscal stimulus.

PayPal stock's relative strength line is looking bullish. It has been on a strong upward trajectory since the end of December, and is currently at all-time highs.

PayPal stock has an excellent Composite Rating of 97. A strong mixture of stock market performance and earnings growth are key features of the payment processor. IBD Stock Checkup shows EPS has swollen by an average 17% over the past three quarters, which is not quite ideal. But growth over the past three years exceeds CAN SLIM requirements.

Things were looking good for PayPal before the coronavirus crisis hit. The firm added 37.3 million net new active accounts in 2019 for a total of 305 million. The Venmo person-to-person money-transfer service now has 52 million users.

The digital payment processor's stock surged in high volume May 7 after it said key business trends improved in April amid the global coronavirus lockdown. It moved higher even though earnings, revenue and total payment volume were below estimates.

Some analysts believe PayPal will weather a recession better than many payment processing companies.

"With little brick-and-mortar transaction volume and what appears to be surging online buying, we think PayPal's payment volumes are holding up quite well," Canaccord Genuity analyst Joseph Vafi said in a recent report to clients.

Supporting PayPal's case is the fact that recent results from payments giants Mastercard and Visa (V) are cause for further cautious optimism. Both names posted better-than-expected earnings. In addition, Wedbush Securities analyst Moshe Katri noted there has been a "massive shift" from credit-card-present to card-not-present transactions. This bodes well for online payment processors like PayPal.

ASML Stock

ASML stock broke out on May 20, and is now modestly extended from a 306 buy point. The 5% chase zone ends at 321.30. Investors also could treat the left-hand side as a key resistance area, with 319.32 as the entry. From that standpoint, ASML stock is in buy range.

In addition, the relative strength line for ASML stock has been generally trending upward since January 2019.

ASML stock has a top-notch Composite Rating of 96. Stock Checkup shows earnings are slightly better than stock market performance, though it is close. Nevertheless, average EPS growth of 14% over the past three years is shy of CAN SLIM requirements.

ASML stock fell 40% in the coronavirus stock market crash from late February to late March before starting its recovery. It is now up just over 7% so far for the year.

On April 15, Netherlands-based ASML reported first-quarter earnings that missed expectations but said demand for its products remained strong. The company blamed business disruptions from the coronavirus pandemic for missing its earnings target.

ASML opted not to give guidance for the second quarter and full year given uncertainties in the market.

UnitedHealth Stock

The managed care stock closed Friday at 304.85. That's above an early entry at 300.10 or a handle buy point at 304.10. It's just below the consolidation's left-hand peak, which has an alternate entry of 306.81.

The outperformance of UNH stock is reflected in its relative strength line. It is well above February levels, though it is below its April 16 peak, the second day of a post-earnings relief rally.

UnitedHealth stock has been leading a move among managed care stocks, which as showing strength as the coronavirus stock market rally rotates beyond big tech.

UNH stock has a strong IBD Composite Rating of 97 out of a possible 99. The Stock Checkup Tool shows earnings have grown by an average of 22% over the past three years. This is good for such a big company, even though it is just below CAN SLIM requirements.

Its potent mix of stock market and earnings performance has seen it added to the Long-Term Leaders list. It is reserved for stocks with stable earnings, stable price performance, and high-quality institutional sponsorship that will outperform the market.

After topping first quarter estimates with "minimal impact" from Covid-19, UnitedHealth maintained full-year earnings guidance, predicting positive and negative effects to roughly offset.

UnitedHealth is not a high-growth tech name, but that can be a plus. Its status as a Long-Term Leader and as a non-tech company means it can offer balance to a portfolio that is heavy on volatile growth stocks.

UnitedHealth stock is one of only a trio of Dow Jones components that have managed to drive above pre-coronavirus highs. The others are Home Depot (HD) and Walmart (WMT), though the latter has fallen away from this post-Covid-19 peak.

Recently Removed Stocks

Pool (POOL) was thrown overboard after becoming extended above its buy zone. It is still worth watching however.

Please follow Michael Larkin on Twitter at @IBD_MLarkin for more on growth stocks and analysis.

      These Are The 5 Best Stocks To Buy And Watch Now

      Licensing
      • MICHAEL LARKIN
      • 06:00 PM ET 05/29/2020

      Buying a stock is easy, but buying the right stock without a time-tested strategy is incredibly hard. So what are the best stocks to buy now or put on a watchlist? Microsoft (MSFT), Apple (AAPL), PayPal (PYPL), ASML (ASML) and UnitedHealth (UNH) are looking stronger as the stock market continues to bounce back from the severe coronavirus correction.

      Apple Stock

      On a daily chart, Apple stock is extended from a 228.35 cup-with-handle buy point and is now just below an alternate handle entry of 319.79. On a weekly chart, the 319.79 entry is the conventional buy point. AAPL stock cleared 319.79 three times in the last week, including Friday, but has yet to close above that level.

      The relative strength line for Apple stock is around record highs. Apple stock has a strong Composite Rating of 92 out of a best-possible 99, but the IBD Stock Checkup tool shows earnings growth has been disappointing of late. It has averaged 5% growth over the past three quarters, though earnings growth is accelerating.

      The firm managed to beat Wall Street's targets for its coronavirus-impacted March quarter. The Cupertino, Calif.-based company earned $2.55 a share on sales of $58.31 billion in its fiscal second quarter ended March 28. Analysts were looking for Apple earnings of $2.26 a share on sales of $54.54 billion.

      Apple is also weighing whether to delay the launch of its first 5G smartphones by months, possibly into 2021. The coronavirus pandemic has threatened Apple's production schedule as well as global demand.

      PayPal Stock

      The Leaderboard stock is just out of buy range from a short-stroke follow-on entry point of 147.30. It comes after a breakaway gap created an alternate entry of 143.33, from which PayPal stock is now extended. PayPal stock has been rallying strongly since hitting a low of 82.07 on March 3.

      PYPL stock is leading the rebound in payment stocks. Mastercard (MA) gave investors interested in the space reasons for optimism, as it has said it is seeing a slight rebound in credit card use amid a relaxation in social distancing rules and fiscal stimulus.

      PayPal stock's relative strength line is looking bullish. It has been on a strong upward trajectory since the end of December, and is currently at all-time highs.

      PayPal stock has an excellent Composite Rating of 97. A strong mixture of stock market performance and earnings growth are key features of the payment processor. IBD Stock Checkup shows EPS has swollen by an average 17% over the past three quarters, which is not quite ideal. But growth over the past three years exceeds CAN SLIM requirements.

      Things were looking good for PayPal before the coronavirus crisis hit. The firm added 37.3 million net new active accounts in 2019 for a total of 305 million. The Venmo person-to-person money-transfer service now has 52 million users.

      The digital payment processor's stock surged in high volume May 7 after it said key business trends improved in April amid the global coronavirus lockdown. It moved higher even though earnings, revenue and total payment volume were below estimates.

      Some analysts believe PayPal will weather a recession better than many payment processing companies.

      "With little brick-and-mortar transaction volume and what appears to be surging online buying, we think PayPal's payment volumes are holding up quite well," Canaccord Genuity analyst Joseph Vafi said in a recent report to clients.

      Supporting PayPal's case is the fact that recent results from payments giants Mastercard and Visa (V) are cause for further cautious optimism. Both names posted better-than-expected earnings. In addition, Wedbush Securities analyst Moshe Katri noted there has been a "massive shift" from credit-card-present to card-not-present transactions. This bodes well for online payment processors like PayPal.

      ASML Stock

      ASML stock broke out on May 20, and is now modestly extended from a 306 buy point. The 5% chase zone ends at 321.30. Investors also could treat the left-hand side as a key resistance area, with 319.32 as the entry. From that standpoint, ASML stock is in buy range.

      In addition, the relative strength line for ASML stock has been generally trending upward since January 2019.

      ASML stock has a top-notch Composite Rating of 96. Stock Checkup shows earnings are slightly better than stock market performance, though it is close. Nevertheless, average EPS growth of 14% over the past three years is shy of CAN SLIM requirements.

      ASML stock fell 40% in the coronavirus stock market crash from late February to late March before starting its recovery. It is now up just over 7% so far for the year.

      On April 15, Netherlands-based ASML reported first-quarter earnings that missed expectations but said demand for its products remained strong. The company blamed business disruptions from the coronavirus pandemic for missing its earnings target.

      ASML opted not to give guidance for the second quarter and full year given uncertainties in the market.

      UnitedHealth Stock

      The managed care stock closed Friday at 304.85. That's above an early entry at 300.10 or a handle buy point at 304.10. It's just below the consolidation's left-hand peak, which has an alternate entry of 306.81.

      The outperformance of UNH stock is reflected in its relative strength line. It is well above February levels, though it is below its April 16 peak, the second day of a post-earnings relief rally.

      UnitedHealth stock has been leading a move among managed care stocks, which as showing strength as the coronavirus stock market rally rotates beyond big tech.

      UNH stock has a strong IBD Composite Rating of 97 out of a possible 99. The Stock Checkup Tool shows earnings have grown by an average of 22% over the past three years. This is good for such a big company, even though it is just below CAN SLIM requirements.

      Its potent mix of stock market and earnings performance has seen it added to the Long-Term Leaders list. It is reserved for stocks with stable earnings, stable price performance, and high-quality institutional sponsorship that will outperform the market.

      After topping first quarter estimates with "minimal impact" from Covid-19, UnitedHealth maintained full-year earnings guidance, predicting positive and negative effects to roughly offset.

      UnitedHealth is not a high-growth tech name, but that can be a plus. Its status as a Long-Term Leader and as a non-tech company means it can offer balance to a portfolio that is heavy on volatile growth stocks.

      UnitedHealth stock is one of only a trio of Dow Jones components that have managed to drive above pre-coronavirus highs. The others are Home Depot (HD) and Walmart (WMT), though the latter has fallen away from this post-Covid-19 peak.

      Recently Removed Stocks

      Pool (POOL) was thrown overboard after becoming extended above its buy zone. It is still worth watching however.

      Please follow Michael Larkin on Twitter at @IBD_MLarkin for more on growth stocks and analysis.
